info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 7:46PM CST until February 18 at 8:45PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Ogle County in north central Illinois... Winnebago County in north central Illinois... Boone County in north central Illinois... * Until 845 PM CST. * At 745 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Clinton to 7 miles east of Massbach, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 112 and 123. I-90 between mile markers 1 and 30. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Belvidere, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, South Beloit, Rockton, Poplar Grove, Byron, Mount Morris, Polo, Rockford Airport, Candlewick Lake, Cherry Valley, Winnebago, Davis Junction, Pecatonica, Forreston, Durand and Capron. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or to stop! If stopped on the roadway or involved in an accident, quickly exit your vehicle move as far away from the roadway as possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain control.
